title: Road Trips to Athletic Events
name: Road Trips to Athletic Events
description:
A Map by Sivy

This map shows ten of the most memorable professional and collegiate sporting events I have attended, and where they were located.

properties.name: Alabama vs. Tennessee (Bryant-Denny Stadium)
properties.description: Posted by SivyLast year, a large group of us made a road trip down to Tuscaloosa. We were hoping that this must win game for the Vols would come out in our favor. In the end, we suffered a lopsided loss to the Tide. However, the pre-game and post game partying were second only to the Starkville trip, in my opinion.

properties.name: Atlanta Braves vs. Florida Marlins (Turner Field)
properties.description: Posted by SivyI got to see the Marlins beat the Braves in a three game weekend homestand. Dontrelle Willis pitched a decent game and the Marlins had enough hitting to win the game.

properties.name: Atlanta Braves vs. Florida Marlins (Turner Field)
properties.description: Posted by SivyTwo years ago, I went on a trip down to Atlanta one weekend while the Braves were on a home stand. I only got to attend one game but I enjoyed watching the Marlins win a convincing one over the Braves mostly due to all of the young talented hitters they had acquired that year.

properties.name: Georgia vs. Tennessee (Sanford Stadium)
properties.description: Posted by SivyMy freshman year of college, a small group of my friends went down to Athens for the game. We ended up winning after gaining momentum in the second half. This was one of the most important wins of the season that year.

properties.name: Georgia vs. Tennessee (Sanford Stadium)
properties.description: Posted by SivyMy freshman year at UT, me and a few of my fraternity brothers went down to Athens to see the Vols play the Dawgs. The game turned out to be a very important victory for us that year.

properties.name: LSU vs. Tennessee (Tiger Stadium)
properties.description: Posted by SivyI went to this game when I was in middle school with my family. We got beat miserably and left at halftime in attempts to escape the LSU fans. The LSU fans yelled "Tiger Bait" to all us UT fans.

properties.name: Reds vs. Astros (Great American Ballpark)
properties.description: Posted by SivyI got the chance to go to this game because my Dad is a federal prosecutor and had to go to Cincinnati to do a case. I went there with him to see exactly what goes on in the courtroom and watch some baseball. Although the Reds\' offense has quite a few sluggers, Roy Oswalt pitched a great game and held them off for the victory.

properties.name: St. Louis Cardinals vs. Atlanta Braves (old Busch Stadium)
properties.description: Posted by SivyThis event occurred in 1996, the same year that the Braves made it to the World Series. Although I am an avid Cardinals fan, I had to sit through a three game sweep of my team by the likes of Chipper, Klesko, and of course the ledgendary pitching rotation.

properties.name: Tennessee Titans vs. Jacksonville Jaguars (LP Field)
properties.description: Posted by SivyThe Jaguars played the Titans at home in November last year. I was lucky enough to get tickets because of some fraternity brothers of mine that are from Brentwood, TN. Unfortunately, Vince Young and the Titans ended up losing.

properties.name: Tennessee Vols vs. Florida Gators (Neyland Stadium)
properties.description: Posted by SivyAlthough I have attended Vols games as a college student, this is the most memorable one I have ever attended. While I have seen quite a few crazy game, this one must top the list. It occurred in 1998, the magical season where the Vols won the national championship. After a missed field goal by the Gators\' kicker, the stadium erupted into a riot in a fashion that I have not seen since. Goal posts were ripped down and thrown in the river while law enforcement had little power to control the victorious mob of Tennessee fans as they had their night of celebration.

properties.name: Tennessee Vols vs. Mississippi State Bulldogs (Davis Wade Stadium)
properties.description: Posted by SivyI went to this game in the fall of 2007. We won a fairly unexciting game but that was not the best part of the trip. The partying we did in the days prior to the game and after were second to none in any college road trip I have been on. I love the atmosphere in Starkville and look forward to returning there soon.

properties.name: Tennessee Vols vs. Ole Miss Rebels (Liberty Bowl)
properties.description: Posted by SivyIn this particular year, the Vols met up with the Rebels at the Liberty Bowl. This regular season game took place in the Memphis State\'s football stadium, also known as the Liberty Bowl. Peyton Manning and the Vols handed a slaughtering to the Rebels.

properties.name: Titans vs. Jaguars (LP Field)
properties.description: Posted by SivyI got to see this game because some buddies of mine from Brentwood, TN were able to get tickets. The Titans ended up getting beat in a close game by the Jaguars.
